channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: George Senate Races Attracting Attention from Corporate America
item.description: the vote is scheduled for Jan. 5, but in-person early voting starts today. Looking ahead... Its online fundraising platform processed nearly $112 million in donations from Nov. 4 and Nov. 23 (the GOP equivalent processed $55.6 million).
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Roblox, Affirm Delay IPOs to Early 2021
item.description: And even companies that make no money are soaring: At least three electric vehicle companies worth more than $2 billion have no revenue. Recent IPO trends may lead them to sell more shares or price them differently. Affirm and Roblox were hoping for valuations as high as $10 billion and $8 billion, respectively.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The First Covid-19 Vaccines Are Being Delivered
item.description: Altogether, around 3 million doses will snake their way to 636 distribution centers across the country in the coming days. ¬† The vaccine requires two shots a month apart, so officials are saving the second half of the ~6.4 million doses planned for the first wave to send out in a few weeks. ¬† Supply chain: In 2009, delivery timetables for the swine flu vaccine shifted regularly. It's expected to get approval. The remaining challenges Spoilage: Pfizer's vaccine needs to maintain -94¬∞F, and although the company has equipped shipping containers with dry ice and GPS-enabled temperature sensors, it's expected that some doses won't survive the journey. ¬†
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The Week Ahead: Tesla's Grand Entrance and Another Vaccine
item.description: ¬†¬† Everything else: Christopher Nolan's Tenet will be released digitally on Tuesday. ¬†¬† Tesla gets promoted: On Friday, Elon Musk's $578 billion electric automaker will join the S&P 500 index. Friday is National Ugly Sweater Day. A major snowstorm could hit the East Coast mid-week.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Kevin From 'The Office' Will Bring in More Than $1 Million on Cameo This Year
item.description: But Galanis thinks President Trump would crush Dobrik if he joined Cameo. Since he charges $195/video, we estimate Baumgartner will have averaged at least 14 videos per day in 2020.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Your Candy Bar Has a Dark Secret
item.description: ¬† Originally filed in 2005, the case alleges the companies violated international laws against child slavery." Nestl√© and Cargill say they've made efforts to eliminate child labor from supply chains. The chocolate supply chain is riddled with child labor. ¬†¬† That's one of the problems with the cocoa supply chain. ¬† An October report from the Labor Department estimates ~1.6 million children are working on cocoa farms. A decision on the side of Nestl√© and Cargill could affect future human rights cases brought under the ATS. ¬†¬† This case could have big implications for corporate liability The case centers on the Alien Tort Statute (ATS), a provision nearly as old as the U.S. that provides a path for foreign nationals to sue over violations of international law or U.S. treaties abroad in American courts. ¬† This wasn't the Court's first dance with ATS. ¬† They won't have to worry... ¬† Ex.: The ATS has been invoked in conversations around corporate liability for supply chains linked to imprisoned Uighur Muslims in China." ¬† While the justices weren't convinced that ATS was the right statute to use in pursuit of this case...
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Hyundai Acquires Boston Dynamics and Its Robot Dogs for $1.1 Billion
item.description: ¬† Some of the sectors Boston Dynamics‚Äôs tech might help with one day: self-driving vehicles, smart factories, and healthcare.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Popping IPO Market Could Be ‚ÄúBroken‚Äù
item.description: In 2019, just three newly public companies did. ¬† For Chesky, the gap between Airbnb‚Äôs debut share price of $68 and the $139/share it actually opened at translates to billions of dollars of missed opportunity (had the company initially sold its shares at that higher price). Plus, these first-day pops can make shares look soggy later.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Short Sellers on Pace for Worst Year Ever
item.description: Two of the most popular targets for short sellers, Moderna and Tesla, have gained 702% and 629% this year, respectively, wiping out short sellers‚Äô March profits. ¬† A quick refresher: Short sellers make money when a company loses value. ¬† But it‚Äôs been nothing but pain ever since.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Corporations Across Sectors Prepare to Make and Distribute the Vaccine
item.description: ¬† Pfizer and Moderna are expected to generate $32 billion in Covid-19 vaccine sales in 2021, according to Wall Street forecasts. They‚Äôre confident that together they have the capacity to deliver both the life-saving shot and the Christmas sweater you sent your aunt.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Finance Bosses Look Beyond Wall Street to Florida
item.description: ¬† Yesterday, Ken Moelis, the chairman and CEO of New York investment bank Moelis & Co., told Bloomberg he wouldn't stop his employees from moving to Florida. ¬† It‚Äôs not just finance‚Ä¶ And it‚Äôs not just New York bleeding business leaders. And if that talent wants to do it in Florida, that‚Äôs where we‚Äôll support them.‚Äù ¬† Right on cue, software giant Oracle said yesterday it was moving its HQ from Redwood City, CA, to Austin, TX. ¬† It‚Äôs not exactly a secret that Florida is warmer than New York, boasts a cheaper cost of living, and has world-class institutions like Publix. ¬† ¬† Why now?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Sony Buys Crunchyroll, Consolidates the Big Business of Bringing Japanese Anime to Western Viewers
item.description: Netflix can appease the casual viewer by sprinkling shows and movies into its existing service, while Funimation x Crunchyroll can satisfy the straight-from-Japan needs of the truly anime-obsessed. ¬† Crunchyroll gives Sony a Snorlax-sized foothold in anime¬† In 2019, Sony combined three anime streaming services under its roof‚ÄîFrance‚Äôs Wakanim, Australia‚Äôs Madman Anime Group, and the U.S.' Funimation‚Äîinto a joint venture between Sony Pictures Entertainment and Sony Music Entertainment‚Äôs subsidiary, Aniplex. On Wednesday, Sony-owned anime streaming service Funimation agreed to acquire anime streaming service Crunchyroll from AT&T for $1.2 billion. But getting anime from Japan to the U.S. has historically been a slow and painful process. Medium dive: Read this Quora answer on the history of anime production, this Reddit thread on financing, and ‚ÄúThe Dark Side of Japan‚Äôs Anime Industry‚Äù by Eric Margolis. Crunchyroll will also be folded into this streaming giant, which could mean a complete merger or just an exchange of content. Here‚Äôs how it works: Most anime is a collaboration between a studio and a production committee. That rabid love raises the question of whether anime is better suited to an all-in-one streamer like Netflix or a standalone service like Crunchyroll. Once an anime gets made, distribution is quick and painless... Deep dive: Listen to Anime in America from Crunchyroll and read The Soul of Anime: Collaborative Creativity and Japan‚Äôs Media Success Story by Ian Condry. there‚Äôs room for both Sony and Netflix to be successful anime streamers if the genre‚Äôs appeal continues to grow beyond its most hardcore fans. Enter: streaming services Pay-per-month services are getting anime to Western fans in two ways: The Crunchyroll way: In 2006, Crunchyroll started as a quasi-legal YouTube channel for fan-subtitled anime, but evolved into an above-board streaming service in 2009. When Cartoon Network started Toonami (part of Adult Swim) in 1997, the co-creators looked beyond the U.S. for more adult cartoons at the turn of the millennia. Foreign: U.S. media companies didn‚Äôt think there would be demand for content that‚Äôs not from Hollywood. Both will achieve the same end goal: exporting Japanese anime to Western audiences. Sometimes, major studios like Kyoto Animation and Shaft are part of the production committees themselves, according to this highly detailed Reddit post. ¬† Looking ahead... Adult Swim SVP Jason DeMarco wrote on Twitter that it‚Äôs ‚Äúdoubtful‚Äù any of the original shows Toonami and Crunchyroll are currently co-producing will be affected.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

And if that talent wants to do it in Florida, that‚Äôs where we‚Äôll support them.‚Äù ¬† Right on cue, software giant Oracle said yesterday it was moving its HQ from Redwood City, CA, to Austin, TX. ¬† It‚Äôs not exactly a secret that Florida is warmer than New York, boasts a cheaper cost of living, and has world-class institutions like Publix. ¬† ¬† Why now?

item.title: How to Host a Company Holiday Party During Covid?
item.description: ¬†¬† But ordinary times these are not. ¬† One benefit of an online holiday party? ¬† You‚Äôll find everything you need right here. What is Slack‚Äôs video function but an opportunity for embarrassment waiting to happen? We aren‚Äôt so sure. ‚ÄúAt corporate holiday parties, you typically get a handful of folks who end up drinking too much and do something embarrassing,‚Äù Ryan Costello of Event Farm told the WSJ.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Jobless Claims, Food Insecurity Rise
item.description: ¬† ¬† Housing: A homebuying boom has added a collective $1 trillion in homeowner equity this year (an average of $17,000 per homeowner), according to CoreLogic. Applications from self-employed and gig workers for a federal program rose 48%, but that program expires Dec. 26.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Disney Announces Disney+ Content Slate
item.description: Zoom out: Disney‚Äôs streaming unit is growing rapidly, but still incurring big losses ($2.8 billion in fiscal year 2020) that analysts expect to peak in the next two years. ¬† But Disney isn't planning to follow WarnerMedia down that path just yet. WarnerMedia is planning joint theater-HBO Max premieres next year.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: FDA Approves Pfizer-BioNTech Vaccine, Raising Questions Over Who Counts as Essential
item.description: ¬† ¬† Now comes the hard part¬† Pfizer, BioNTech, and other manufacturers have generated lifesaving products at a breathtaking speed... ¬† Bottom line: It will ultimately fall to the states to decide which workers are ‚Äúessential‚Äù enough to receive the first, limited doses of the vaccine. Currently, the only clear directive is that healthcare workers and residents of long-term care facilities go first‚Äîand no industry reps dispute that. ¬† Unblinding would hamstring the research process... but it would also get people vaccinated.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: FDA Approves Pfizer-BioNTech Vaccine, Raising Questions Over Who Counts as Essential

item.title: ETFs: Everything You Need To Know, And Then Some
item.description: One More ETF FYI As a beginner investment vehicle, ETFs can be a wonderful way to get a hang of the market and all of its fluctuations. If your brokerage charges you fees when you buy or sell ETF shares, its cost effectiveness can go out the window. ¬† ETFs can track indexes from bonds to the NASDAQ, so find one that represents your own risk-tolerance and long-term plan. ¬† An under-the-radar stock that could overperform. You can find out what the management team tracks their performance to, which is a good indicator to determine if you want that for your own portfolio. So good luck, and ETFs FTW. ETFs are not Always Cheaper It‚Äôs true, ETFs can be more cost-effective for the average investor than other funds. ¬† In case you forgot, ETFs‚Äîor Exchange-Traded Funds‚Äîare funds that are traded on public exchanges just like a stock. If you read our Ultimate Guide to Investing, created with our friends at The Motley Fool, you‚Äôll remember our comparison of ETFs to succulents.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: International News Updates
item.description: ¬† ¬† Canada: The country‚Äôs health regulator approved Pfizer-BioNTech‚Äôs Covid-19 vaccine, becoming the second nation after the UK to do so. ¬† Brazil: Passengers on a Gol Airlines flight from Sao Paulo to Porto Alegre were the first in nearly two years to travel on a Boeing 737 Max, which returned to commercial service yesterday.

item.description: ¬†¬† Bottom line: These lawsuits probably aren't the Jake Paul to Facebook‚Äôs Nate Robinson... ¬† Yesterday, the twin investigations emerged from their chrysalises into full-fledged lawsuits.

item.title: Airbnb Goes Public After Turbulent Year for Travel
item.description: ¬† The company had a roller-coaster year. If this week‚Äôs IPOs were a music festival, DoorDash would be the opener that rocked so hard everyone started moshing. As a public company, Airbnb will face a number of challenges, including angry city officials, concerns over safety, and a rising number of professional hosts who threaten Airbnb‚Äôs identity as a platform that connects people with... To swing the pendulum back toward individuals, Airbnb is creating a host endowment fund through its IPO to invest in the people who make its platform work.
item.author: Neal Freyman

The laws loosened some rules around the pricing and storage of crops, and farmers argue the deregulation will devastate their incomes.

item.title: Apple Unveils the AirPods Max, Its First Over-Ear Headphones
item.description: If you're looking for a new way to flex on your Zoom calls, Apple unveiled its first over-ear headphones yesterday, the AirPods Max. It'd be quite the flex. the headphones arrive Dec. 15, and Apple's workout service, Fitness+ ($9.99/mo. ¬† Looking ahead...

item.title: HBO Max: Strong User Growth, But Fallout From Upending Theatrical Window Continues
item.description: According to AT&T CEO John Stankey, HBO Max will notch 12.6 million activated accounts by today. ¬† The straight-to-streaming decision has upset Hollywood creators. 30... In a fiery statement Monday night, filmmaker Christopher Nolan said, "They don't even understand what they're losing. ¬†
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Cybersecurity Giant FireEye Suffers Massive Attack
item.description: ¬† So this is like if an animal control office got infested by raccoons. ¬† What FireEye is: the go-to security provider for governments and companies that suffer sophisticated hacks; for instance, it helped Sony and Equifax bulletproof their operations following breaches.
item.author: Eliza Carter
